A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The Last Jedi is thematically about ending the ties to the past (Kylo Ren drives the metaphor home literally\, several times)\, and it's an understandable goal. After all\, how does the series continue on its' own if it is rooted in the original trilogy? There would be little room for creativity that most fans probably crave.

That being said\, The Last Jedi is a weak installment. The plot twists are handled quickly; once is shocking\, twice is alright\, three times or more and it's annoying. The treatment of one character's story is handled poorly (even with understanding the point of letting go and dying a peaceful life in a struggle-filled life). Some scenes or laughable in a bad way (Leia in space). There was an odd romance arc that had not a trace of build-up that came out of the blue. There is also a villain problem\, as the antagonist for the series seems rather weak and ineffectual.

What killed it for me though\, was the pacing of the story. This is a long movie\, and the majority of the plot revolves around... waiting for the good guys to run out of gas. The resolutions are handled quickly and abruptly\, while the seemingly insignificant parts are dragged out.

Don't get me wrong\, it's still a star wars movie\, but it's probably one of the worst I have seen.
